title: POP - Hotmail - Unable to see "Sent Items" folder on Thunderbird Mac
content:
Hi,

I'd like to archive my recently passing family member hotmail account.

I setup Hotmail (using POP) with Thunderbird MacOSX already (with the hope that I can just backup the user profile to the cold storage).

The thing is, I cannot see the "SENT" folder locally.

I tried to create a new folder "SENT" and point the setting (Copies & Folders > place a copy in) to use that "SENT" folder, but after sync, nothing appears on that folder.

I saw a similar request raised (here), but in that scenario, the person is using IMAP; while I'm using POP.

Is there any setting that I missed?

Thanks
creator: jsid001

title: Duplicated events in Calendar using Provider for Google Calendar
content: I'm getting duplicates of calendar items using the Provider for Google Calendar whenever I enter an event in Thunderbird. This doesn't happen when the events are posted elsewhere, on a Google Calendar. When I'm about to enter a new event, I can see a line labeled "Calendar" that gives me 3 choices ... 2 of them are the same, like xxxxx@gmail.com and the other is GMAIL. I have 2 gmail accounts sharing on three devices ... my laptop, my phone and my wife's iPad. Once I've finished and closed the event, I wait a bit and I get the duplicated item beside it. When I right-click on an event that I've put into Thunderbird, I see a line that says "Organizer:" with my gmail address. I don't see anything like that when clicking on a duplicate that has popped up. There is also a Related Link ... https://calendar.google.com/calendar/u/0/event?eid=X2M5ajYyZTluNnRpajBiOWo2OWg2YWI5a2NkaGphYmIyYzhzNjRiOW02cGozaW9wcGNkaW04b2hnY2tfMjAyNDAxMTFUMTgzMDAwWiBnaGNoYXJ0ZXJzQG0 ... but it comes up as "requested URL not found on this server". I hope I've provided enough information here to get this situation resolved. Any help would be greatly appreciated. Thanks, Gil
creator: gil.charters

title: Outgoing email error message.
content:
I am trying to use Thunderbird email client. I have set up pop email account. pop.cox.net, port 995, SSL/TSL, normal password. On the outgoing email, smtp.cox.net, port 465, SSL/TSL, normal password. Incoming email is working find. Outgoing mail, however, I am encountering error message: "Sending of the message failed. An error occurred while sending mail: Outgoing server (SMTP) error. The server responded: cxr-obgw-6004a.stratus.cloudmark.com cmsmtp 192.145.119.62 blocked. Refer to Error Codes section at https://www.cox.com/residential/support/email-error-codes.html for more information. AUP#CXDNS."

Can you please help? Thank you in advance.

one-for-all@cox.net
creator: millenniumhawk

title: Email - Bigpond setting configuration
content: Thunderbird fail to configure email settings - cannot add mail to thunderbird. Password and email is correct.
creator: revdpeel

title: How I managed to import a vcard file into Thunderbird
content: In case this is helpful ... I lost all my Thunderbird contacts when my old computer failed so I wanted to import contacts from my Android phone. I exported all my phone contacts to a .vcf file and then tried to import that file into Thunderbird. It took a while to read about 1000 contacts and when it was done there were no contacts in my address book. Interestingly, when I exported that seemingly empty address book from Thunderbird as a .csv file it was fully populated. I read that file into Excel and deleted a bunch of empty rows and rows with garbage in them. Then I read the edited .csv file back into Thunderbird with success! This took me several hours to accomplish with much trial and error.
creator: jmeisner1

title: No Gaps/Space in Mail Reply Space
content:
Dears,

When I try to reply to an incoming mail, there is no space on the screen to write my text. It is only filled with my signature and the mail I am replying to. The attached screenshot will help you understand the problem. I want there to be a space where I can write at the very beginning, but there is not. I cannot scroll the signature down either. Thanks in advance
